page.title: 10LIFE IN A TOWER BLOCK 2
page.content: Life in a tower block seems to suit retired people. Some of the retired people living in the tower block agreed that it was not suitable accommodation for children. At the moment families with children are housed on the lower levels and the Council has a policy of rehousing these families. The older people like the feeling of security from intruders. They enjoy the views. One woman said that it was like looking at a "sea of grass" when she looked at the view across the fields. The flats are quiet because the windows have been double-glazed. There is a caretaker to look after the flats and their occupants. Given the opportunity to speak to the designers the people interviewed though that generally speaking they had done a good job.
